libfastrtps.so.2.11: libfastrtps.so.2.11 is a shared library file that provides an implementation of the Fast RTPS (Real-Time Publish-Subscribe) protocol for use in C++ applications. The Fast RTPS protocol is designed to enable high-performance, low-latency communication between publishers and subscribers in real-time systems. This library is typically used in robotics, automation, and other fields where real-time data exchange is critical.
libstdc++.so.6: libstdc++.so.6 is a shared library file that provides the implementation of the C++ Standard Library, including features such as memory management, input/output operations, string manipulation, and more. It is typically used in C++ programs to provide the necessary functionality for building complex applications.
libgcc_s.so.1: libgcc_s.so.1 is a shared library file that provides the implementation of the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) for C, C++, and other languages. It includes various optimizations and features that are specific to the version of GCC being used, as well as additional libraries that may be needed by other parts of the program. This library is typically used when building programs that require the performance benefits of the GCC compiler.
libc.so.6: libc.so.6 is a shared library file that provides the core functionality of the C programming language, including system calls, memory management, and other essential components of the C runtime environment. It is typically used by programs written in C or C++ to interact with the operating system and perform various tasks such as reading from files, writing to files, managing processes, and more.
libfastcdr.so.1: libfastcdr.so.1 is a shared library file that provides the implementation of the Fast CDR (Common Data Representation) serialization and deserialization protocol, which is commonly used in communication between different software components or systems. This protocol allows for efficient and flexible data exchange between different programming languages and platforms. The library includes support for various data types, including basic primitives, complex structures, and arrays, as well as custom data types defined by the user.
libtinyxml2.so.9: libtinyxml2.so.9 is a shared library file that provides an implementation of the TinyXML-2 XML parsing and manipulation library for C++ applications. It allows developers to parse, validate, and manipulate XML data in their programs with ease. The library includes features such as XPath support, simple event-driven parsing, and a lightweight and efficient design that makes it suitable for use in resource-constrained environments.
libssl.so.3: libssl.so.3 is a shared library file that provides an implementation of the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols, which are used for secure communication over networks. This library allows applications to establish secure connections with servers and other clients using encryption and authentication mechanisms. It supports various cryptographic algorithms and protocol versions, including TLS 1.2 and earlier versions. The library is commonly used in web browsers, email clients, and other applications that require secure data transmission.
libcrypto.so.3:
libcrypto.so.3 is a shared library file that provides an implementation of the OpenSSL cryptographic library, which includes various cryptographic algorithms and protocols for secure communication. This library is commonly used in applications that require secure data transmission, such as web browsers, email clients, and other online services. It supports various cryptographic algorithms, including 

- RSA encryption and decryption
- AES encryption and decryption
- SHA-1 and SHA-256 hashing algorithms
- HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code)
- Diffie-Hellman key exchange
- PKCS#1 and PKCS#8 certificate encoding and decoding
- Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols

The libcrypto.so.3 library is often used in conjunction with the libssl.so.3 library, which provides additional support for SSL/TLS protocols.
libm.so.6: libm.so.6 is a shared library file that provides mathematical functions for C and C++ programs, such as trigonometric functions, logarithmic functions, exponential functions, and more. It includes support for various floating-point data types and architectures. The library is commonly used in scientific computing, graphics programming, and other applications that require mathematical operations.
libdl.so.2: libdl.so.2 is a shared library file that provides dynamic linking functionality in Linux and Unix-based systems. It allows programs to load and unload shared libraries at runtime, which can be used to extend the functionality of a program or share code between multiple programs. The library also provides functions for finding and loading shared objects, resolving symbols (functions and variables) within those objects, and unloading them when they are no longer needed. This library is commonly used in many other shared libraries and applications on Linux systems.
libz.so.1: libz.so.1 is a shared library file that provides support for the zlib compression and decompression library, which is commonly used in various applications to compress and decompress data. This library includes functions for working with gzip, deflate, and inflate formats, as well as other compression algorithms. It is commonly used in web servers, email clients, and other applications that need to efficiently compress and decompress data.
libpthread.so.0: libpthread.so.0 is a shared library file that provides support for multithreading in C and C++ programs. It allows multiple threads of execution to run concurrently within a single process, improving the efficiency and responsiveness of applications that require parallel processing. The library includes functions for creating, synchronizing, and managing threads, as well as providing low-level thread management features such as mutexes, condition variables, and semaphores. This library is commonly used in multi-threaded applications, such as server software, real-time systems, and graphics rendering engines.
